an5.206:1.1: “Mendicants, there are these five emotional shackles.
an5.206:1.3: Firstly, a mendicant isn’t free of greed, desire, fondness, thirst, passion, and craving for sensual pleasures.
an5.206:1.4: This being so, their mind doesn’t incline toward keenness, commitment, persistence, and striving.
an5.206:1.5: This is the first emotional shackle.
an5.206:2.1: Furthermore, a mendicant isn’t free of greed for the body …
an5.206:2.2: They’re not free of greed for form …
an5.206:2.3: They eat as much as they like until their belly is full, then indulge in the pleasures of sleeping, lying down, and drowsing …
an5.206:2.4: They lead the spiritual life hoping to be reborn in one of the orders of gods, thinking: ‘By this precept or observance or mortification or spiritual life, may I become one of the gods!’
an5.206:2.5: This being so, their mind doesn’t incline toward keenness, commitment, persistence, and striving.
an5.206:2.6: This is the fifth emotional shackle.
an5.206:2.7: These are the five emotional shackles.”
